snippet: Police Commissioner William J. Bratton said that rather than thrusting inexperienced officers into highly charged situations, rookies would first be placed in local precincts.
abstract: New York City Police Commissioner William J Bratton says he will end practice in which rookie police officers are sent into high crime areas, part of program called Operation Impact; Bratton intends to return to traditional approach in which rookies are placed in local precincts and mentored by more experienced officers, major shift in department's approach to training and street policing.
lead_paragraph: Police Commissioner William J. Bratton said that rather than thrusting inexperienced officers into highly charged situations, rookies would first be placed in local precincts.

headline.main: Bratton Says Rookies’ Role in Anticrime Effort Will End
headline.print_headline: Inexperienced Officers’ Role in an Anticrime Program Will End, Bratton Says
